title: June Elvin, product of the Rank Charm School who was best known for her role in ‘The Life and Adventures of Nicholas Nickleby’ – obituary
text:
June Elvin, who has died aged 95, was a starlet who signed to Ealing Studios shortly after the Second World War; she featured in such films as The Life and Adventures of Nicholas Nickleby before joining the Company of Youth – the celebrated if shortlived “Rank Charm School”.

Intended to manufacture and groom stars in the manner of the Hollywood studios, the school had been established in 1945 by the producer Sydney Box, and was run by the acting teacher Molly Terraine. Alumni included Joan Collins, Honor Blackman, Diana Dors, Christopher Lee and Donald Sinden, although it closed in 1951.
